alert.note: Alert for Marshall; Nemaha (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 05 at 3:34PM CDT until June 05 at 5:45PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Kansas, including the following counties, Brown, Marshall and Nemaha. * WHEN...Until 630 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 333 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Isolated spots have already received between 2 and 4 inches of rain. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sabetha, Seneca, Centralia, Axtell, Fairview, Beattie, Bern, Goff, Vermillion, Oneida, Baileyville, Woodlawn and Kickapoo Reservation.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
